title: Laozi
summary: Lao Tzu (/ˈlaʊ ˈtsuː, -ˈdzʌ/),[2][3][4] also rendered as Laozi (UK: /ˌlaʊˈzɪər/;[2] Chinese: 老子, Mandarin: [làu.tsɹ̩]; commonly translated as "Old Master") and Lao-Tze (/ˈlaʊ ˈdzeɪ/),[5] was an ancient Chinese philosopher and writer.[6] He is the reputed author of the Tao Te Ching,[7] the founder of philosophical Taoism, and a deity in religious Taoism and traditional Chinese religions.
